prompt: Drinking ![dropdown:science_tests1_question6_dropdown1] of these shakes is the least number that would provide the daily recommended allowance of vitamins A and C.
description: A diet meal-replacement shake has 210 calories and 45 calories from fat with no saturated fat. The shake contains 45% of the daily recommended allowance of vitamins A and C, 100% of the daily recommended allowance of calcium, and 15% of the daily recommended allowance of iron.
feedback: The minimum number of shakes that can be drunk to get the recommended daily allowance of vitamins A and C is 3, because drinking just two only gives 90% of the RDA.
